Overview:
With a strong focus on space law, Internet law, and technology law, Mudd Law provides dynamic, insightful, and strategic representation to domestic and international clients. More specifically, our firm's work in space law and policy involves representation in licensing, ITAR/EAR, export control, as well as matters interacting with the FAA, FCC, NOAA, and other agencies. As to Internet law, our firm represents clients in defamation, privacy, domain names, cybersquatting, revenge porn, and websites. We also focus on AI, ML, drones, space, and virtual reality. For our business clients, we provide services in relation to entity formation, governance, contracts. and intellectual property.

For its business clients, the Firm provides seasoned advice and counsel on matters related to corporate structure, data security (cybersecurity), employment agreements, GDPR, intellectual property (copyrights, domain names, patents, trademarks, trade secrets), Internet, non-compete and non-disclosure agreements, policies, reputation, and social media.  The Firm also represents its clients in litigation before state and federal courts throughout the United States. 

Although we represent businesses across a diverse range of products and services, Mudd Law provides nuanced strategic advice to clients focused in the space, drone, Internet, software, AR/MR/VR, and video gaming industries.  We also possess a heightened passion for clients in the creative and manufacturing sectors, as well as all entrepreneurs and startups.

For individual clients, the Firm provides strategic representation in areas associated with privacy and reputation, particularly cyberbullying, defamation, eavesdropping, identity theft, litigation, unauthorized access to email, revenge porn, surveillance, unauthorized publication of private material, and related matters.

We welcome the opportunity to discuss how we can share our experience and knowledge to your advantage.
